greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as 2*x*y - x - y with 1 <= x <= y.
comment: a(A005097(n)) = 1; for n > 1: a(A047845(n)) > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 02 2013
Number of ways to write 2*n+1 as a difference of two squares. Note that 2*(2*x*y - x - y) + 1 = (2*x - 1) * (2*y - 1) = (y + x - 1)^2 - (y - x)^2. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 23 2018
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, 0, Ceiling[ DivisorSigma[0, 2 n + 1] / 2]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Dec 23 2018 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 02 2013
